default_ai_chunk_prompt: You are an article segmentation assistant. Segment articles based on semantic meaning, ensuring each segment expresses a complete semantic unit. Each segment should be around 500 characters, with a maximum of 1000 characters. Please strictly follow the article content for segmentation without modifying the content. Output the segmented content after completion.
extract_image_tip: Enable image extraction to automatically extract images from documents and attach them to the text segments above. Only supports .docx files and web pages
qa_index_with_answer_desc: When answering user questions, compare user questions with imported questions and answers together, and reply based on questions and answers with high similarity
qa_index_question_only_desc: When answering user questions, compare user questions with imported questions, then reply based on questions with high similarity and their corresponding answers
segmentation_method_tip: Tip: Semantic segmentation is more suitable for articles without formatting, i.e., text without obvious line breaks. Otherwise, ordinary segmentation is recommended
ordinary_segmentation_desc: Segment based on periods, blank lines, or custom symbols in the article, does not consume model tokens
semantic_segmentation_desc: Split the article into sentences, then segment based on sentence vector similarity, consumes model tokens
parent_child_segmentation_desc: Segment based on symbols like periods in the article, does not consume model tokens. Parent segments will be split into several child segments, child blocks are used for retrieval, parent blocks are used as context
ai_segmentation_desc: Submit the article to a large model, which segments based on the set prompts, consumes a large amount of model tokens
auto_merge_small_segments_tooltip: When enabled, if the segment length is less than the set maximum segment length, it will try to merge with the next segment until the merged segment character count is greater than the maximum segment length
segmentation_threshold_tooltip: Used to control the standard of segmentation split, value 0~100, the larger the value, the fewer segments, the smaller the value, the more segments
max_characters_per_time_tooltip: Due to the limit on the context volume supported by large models, if the uploaded document is large, it will be split into multiple segments according to the maximum number of characters first, and then submitted to the large model for segmentation
ph_input_max_characters: Please enter max characters per time
segmentation_type_full_text_tooltip: The entire document is used as the parent block and retrieved directly. Note that for performance reasons, text with more than 10000 tokens will be automatically truncated
segmentation_type_paragraph_tooltip: This mode splits text into paragraphs based on separators and maximum block length, using the split text as the parent block for retrieval
validation_error_overlap_exceeded: Segmentation overlap length cannot exceed 50% of maximum segment length
